medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ)
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with 3 days of abdominal pain localized to the RLQ, associated with anorexia, chills, urinary frequency, and subjective fever. Symptoms did not include vomiting or diarrhea. Last bowel movement was the night prior to admission and was normal; patient reported passing flatus.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Hepatitis C 2. Alcohol abuse 3. History of rheumatic fever 4. Hypertension 5. Dyslipidemia 6. History of cocaine abuse 7. Carpal tunnel syndrome 8. Right knee fracture 9. Chronic pain syndrome 10. PTSD following war 11. Hemorrhoids
